comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Most likely the Dreyfus, i.e. Alfred Dreyfus (French pronunciation: [alfʁɛd dʁɛfys]; 9 October 1859 – 12 July 1935), a French artillery officer of Jewish background whose trial and conviction in 1894 on charges of treason became one of the most tense political dramas in modern French and European history. Known today as the Dreyfus Affair, the incident eventually ended with Dreyfus's complete exoneration.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Wikipedia on Alfred Dreyfus: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfred_Dreyfus Reinstated as a Major in the French Army in 1906, Dreyfus served during the entire span of World War I, ending his service with the rank of Lieutenant Colonel. Wikipedia on the Dreyfus Affair: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dreyfus_affair

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Yes, I think that this is Alfred Dreyfus.  Thanks to both of you for finding the links.  We'll expand the caption the next time we update.
